intro: Zollikoferia polyclada, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established. Zollikoferia polyclada is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
